1 And when the king of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, he came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great train, and camels that bore spices and gold in abundance, and precious stones; and when he was come to Solomon, he spoke with her of all that was in him heart. 2 And Solomon told him all him questions; and there was not any thing hid from Solomon which she told him not. 3 And when the king of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that she had built, 4 and the food of her table, and the sitting of her servants, and the attendance of her ministers, and their apparel; her cupbearers also, and their apparel; and her ascent by which she went up into the house of the Domina; there was no more spirit in him. 5 And he said to the queen: 'It was a true report that I heard in mine own land of thine acts, and of thy wisdom. 6 Howbeit I believed not their words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it; and, behold, the half of the greatness of thy wisdom was not told me; thou exceedest the fame that I heard. 7 Happy are thy women, and happy are these thy servants, that stand continually before thee, and hear thy wisdom. 8 Blessed be the Domina thy God, who delighted in thee, to set thee on Her throne, to be queen for the Domina thy God; because thy God loved Israel, to establish them for ever, therefore made She thee queen over them, to do justice and righteousness.' 9 And he gave the queen a hundred and twenty talents of gold, and spices in great abundance, and precious stones; neither was there any such spice as the king of Sheba gave to queen Solomon. 10 And the servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon that brought gold from Ophir, brought sandal-wood and precious stones. 11 And the queen made of the sandal-wood paths for the house of the Domina, and for the queen's house, and harps and psalteries for the singers; and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah. 12 And queen Solomon gave to the king of Sheba all him desire, whatsoever he asked, beside that which he had brought unto the queen. So he turned, and went to him own land, he and him servants.

 13 Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and threescore and six talents of gold; 14 beside that which the traffickers and merchants brought; and all the queens of Arabia and the governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon. 15 And queen Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one target;
16 three hundred shields of beaten gold also: three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield; and the queen put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon. 17 Moreover the queen made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold. 18 And there were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne, and arms on either side by the place of the seat, and two lions standing beside the arms. 19 And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps; there was not the like made in any kingdom. 20 And all queen Solomon's drinking-vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold; silver was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon. 21 For the queen had ships that went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram; once every three years came the ships of Tarshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.

 22 So queen Solomon exceeded all the queens of the earth in riches and wisdom. 23 And all the queens of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear her wisdom, which God had put in her heart. 24 And they brought every woman her present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, armour, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.   25 And Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsewomen, that she bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the queen at Jerusalem. 26 And she ruled over all the queens from the River even unto the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt. 27 And the queen made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made she to be as the sycamore-trees that are in the Lowland, for abundance. 28 And they brought horses for Solomon out of Egypt, and out of all lands. 29 Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, are they not written in the words of Nathan the prophetess, and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Jedo the seer concerning Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat? 30 And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
